case_vignette: A 38-year-old man comes to the physician because of persistent sadness and difficulty concentrating for the past 6 weeks. During this period, he has also had difficulty sleeping. He adds that he has been “feeling down” most of the time since his girlfriend broke up with him 4 years ago. Since then, he has only had a few periods of time when he did not feel that way, but none of these lasted for more than a month. He reports having no problems with appetite, weight, or energy. He does not use illicit drugs or alcohol. Mental status examination shows a depressed mood and constricted affect.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling persistently sad and have been having trouble concentrating for the past 6 weeks.
How old are you?
I am 38 years old.
Have you experienced any changes in your sleep or appetite recently?
I've been having difficulty sleeping, but my appetite has been fine.
Are you currently taking any medication for depression or any other health condition?
No, I'm not taking any medication.
Do you have a history of depression or any other mental health condition?
I've been feeling down most of the time since my girlfriend broke up with me 4 years ago.
Is there a family history of depression or any other mental health condition?
I didn't say anything about my family's health history.

I apologize for assuming that, and respect your privacy. Based on your symptoms and history, it seems like you may be experiencing major depressive disorder.

**Final Diagnosis:** Major Depressive Disorder
